alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Gallatin; Wabash; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 7:55PM CST until March 16 at 9:16PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River .Minor flooding is ongoing across western and southern Indiana due to 1.5 to 3 inches of rainfall that fell Friday March 3rd. Flooding is expected to end at Lafayette Friday...yet flooding is expected to persist on the lower Wabash well into next week with additional rain expected Thursday night and again this weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Mount Carmel. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.9 feet, Extensive lowland flooding in progress. In Wabash County Illinois, South Division Street and 1.5 miles of CR 1280 E remain flooded. High water blocks access to cabins along South Division Street and some nearby oil fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Thursday /8:00 PM EST Thursday/ the stage was 22.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Thursday /8:00 PM EST Thursday/ was 22.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.6 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
